value.title: Google Plans to Double AI Ethics Research Staff
value.excerpt: Vice President of Engineering Marian Croak also said CEO Sundar Pichai has committed to boost the budget of a team tasked with evaluating code and product to avert harm, discrimination and other problems with AI.

value.title: ‘Nurses Are Essential’ to AI Integration in Healthcare
value.excerpt: Nurses are also crucial stakeholders as hospitals seek more uses for artificial intelligence and machine learning to deliver care.

value.title: Expert.ai adds emotion and style detection tools to natural language API
value.excerpt: Expert.ai added new tools to its natural language API to help AI developers detect emotions, behaviors, and styles in large-scale texts.

value.title: Changing The World With Breakthrough AI Innovation In The Age Of Regulation And Cancel Culture
value.excerpt: World in 2021 has seemingly gone mad with censorship, over regulations, and so called “cancel  culture. ”  So, how can disruptive startups circumvent these new developments, and continue to innovate and create economic growth with AI?

value.title: Proper data hygiene critical as enterprises focus on AI governance
value.excerpt: AI use raises pressures to understand the provenance of data. That means greater AI governance will be needed.

value.title: How Adobe’s Ethics Committee Helps Manage AI Bias
value.excerpt: Review boards can help companies mitigate some of the risks associated with using artificial intelligence, an Adobe executive said Wednesday at The Wall Street Journal’s Risk & Compliance Forum.

value.title: POLITICO AI: Decoded: Robot law — Helsinki wants to be Europe’s smartest — China on facial recognition
value.excerpt: How global thinking on AI is shaping the world, from Berlin, Brussels, London and beyond. POLITICO’s AI correspondent cuts through the noise, introduces you to the key decision-makers you’ve never heard of and tells you what those in power don’t want you to know.

value.title: Defining a role for AI ethics in national security
value.excerpt: We spoke with Mariarosaria Taddeo, an associate professor and senior research fellow at the Oxford Internet Institute and Dstl Ethics Fellow at the Alan Turing Institute working on digital and AI ethics about two recent reports from the UK and the US on using AI in national defence and security.

value.title: Apple snaps up ex-Google AI leader who quit in the wake of Timnit Gebru’s firing
value.excerpt: Apple has hired former Google AI scientist Samy Bengio, who resigned from the Big G following the controversial firing of ethics researcher Timnit Gebru.

value.title: Apple hires Google AI veteran Samy Bengio amid ethics controversy
value.excerpt: Apple has hired former Google artificial intelligence (AI) scientist Samy Bengio following his departure from the company after controversy engulfed the Google Brain division. Bengio will lead a new AI research division at Apple and will report to senior vice president of machine learning and AI strategy John Giannandrea,

value.title: Building Ethical AI is Not Easy. But, This Guide Will Help You
value.excerpt: Adopting a sound ethical AI strategy is important to shape future developments. Building ethical AI requires both an ethical way for building AI systems and a strategy for making AI systems themselves moral.

value.title: AI’s ethical issues are exacerbated by increasing scale
value.excerpt: Tiernan Ray says AI has always carried the risk of abuses such as bias. The increasing scale of the field, however, in terms of the size of neural network models, the escaping compute budget, and the proliferation of generated content such as fake faces and fake writing,

value.title: Google-led paper pushes back against claims of AI inefficiency
value.excerpt: In a newly released paper, Google pushes back against the notion that training AI models significantly harms the environment.

value.title: How AI is Mishandled to Become a Cybersecurity Risk
value.excerpt: While infosec specialists use AI for benign purposes, threat actors mishandle it to orchestrate real-world attacks. At this point, it is hard to say who is winning.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence – what about its ethical deployment?
value.excerpt: While companies are making progress deploying artificial intelligence and machine learning, more than half of enterprises overestimate their levels of maturity in deploying responsible AI models.

value.title: AI can help guide our return to the workplace
value.excerpt: As companies around the world begin reopening offices, for example, AI can take on a pivotal new role in the workplace: supporting continuous management and maintenance of facilities. This means that intelligent systems could impact millions of workers who may never have imagined AI playing a role in managing their working environment.

value.title: Google Pressured on Racial Equity Audit After AI Ethics Collapse

value.title: Making AI great again: how do we design ethical AI systems?
value.excerpt: The debate around how AI will shape our future is ongoing, and it is already affecting our present. Accenture investigates how issues around ethics and regulation are becoming increasingly urgent. Artificial intelligence is a powerful agent of change in our society.

value.title: This Researcher Says AI Is Neither Artificial nor Intelligent
value.excerpt: Kate Crawford, who holds positions at USC and Microsoft, says in a new book that even experts working on the technology misunderstand AI.

value.title: Why applied AI requires skills and knowledge beyond data science
value.excerpt: Using machine learning in real-world applications and business problems presents challenges that are absent in academic and scientific research settings.

value.title: Members of Google's ethical AI team reportedly complained about harassment and bias years before being fired
value.excerpt: Two of Google's most high-profile AI researchers reportedly raised concerns around bias, sexual harassment, and bullying before they were ousted.

value.title: Google’s ethical AI researchers complained of harassment long before Timnit Gebru’s firing
value.excerpt: Google’s AI leadership came under fire in December when star ethics researcher Timnit Gebru was abruptly fired while working on a paper about the dangers of large language models. Now, new reporting from Bloomberg suggests the turmoil began long before ...

value.excerpt: The ouster of lead researchers Gebru, Mitchell followed years of friction over how Google handled allegations of harassment and bias

value.title: Hive Raises $85 Million For Contextual And Branded Content AI
value.excerpt: Hive, which supplies AI-based contextual and measurement technology to media and ad tech companies, said Wednesday it raised $85 million in funding, valuing the company at over $2 billion.

value.title: How Communicators Can Help Address Ethical AI Risks
value.excerpt: Fortunately, as communications specialists, we can work cross-functionally to evaluate AI-powered products or services, determine if they have ethical risks and champion actions to manage them.

value.title: The AI arms race has us on the road to Armageddon
value.excerpt: For now, the AI arms race is a cold war, mostly between the U.S., China, and Russia, but worries are it will become more than that. Driven by fear of other countries gaining the upper hand, the world’s military powers have been competing by leveraging AI for years — dating back at least to 1983 — to achieve an advantage in the balance of power .
